subject: Re: ClassNotFound  with junit and ant
msgSnippet: ... test ... all ... Yes,  ${TEST_CONTEXT_BUILD} contains properties files and classes used by testcases. and ${JAVA_BUILD_DIR} contain TestCases and other
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., "Manuel Amago" <mamago@b...> wrote:
> Does your ${TEST_CONTEXT_BUILD} include non-test classes that the
test
> classes may depend on?
>
> Just a thought,
>
> Manuel Amago.
> mailto:mamago@b...
>
> PS: it seems to be a classpath error, since it works when you put
all
> the appropriate classes under the ant/lib dir, which gets included
> automagically by ANT. Try <echo>ing the value of your
> ${TEST_CONTEXT_BUILD} property, and work from that.

Yes, ${TEST_CONTEXT_BUILD} contains properties files and classes
used by testcases.

and ${JAVA_BUILD_DIR} contain TestCases and other dependend class ..
both can be seen in the classpath when run in verbose mode.

The TestCases are combination of Junit and Junitx.

Frustrating thing is finds a class in same classpath but not the
other.
Example if class X loads dynamically class Y.

ant finds class X but not Y even though they are in the same
classpath..${TEST_CONTEXT_BUILD}

Thanks for ur reply

-Shaji
